titleStmt.title: Syntha Carpenter and Julyan M Hughs to Unknown
CWG9193

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To the Govenor of Kentucky yore Petioners of Carter County Syntha Carpenter and Julyan M Hughs has been find ten Dollars Each on a Charge of a Breech of the Peace and We the under Signed do not Believe that they are Gilty of the Charge and Want for you to remit the fine as they are Poore and unable to Pay and if they are required to Pay they Will have to Goe Jail and We the undersigned think it Just and rite for you to remit the fine the fine was assesed before James Garvin a Justice of the Peace for Carter County & in October 1862 in Duty Bond Will Ever Prey at your hands

Signers Names
A A underwood
W B Powers
R R Evans
E. H. Evans
Z: Evans
Joshua Knappe
George L Anderson
David S. Peterson
Signers Names
Alexander Parnis
George W Underwood
Henry Rolown
James Terrell
W. H Gegan
M P Mayne
A Walker
A underwood
Henry Underwood
William A Landown
Isaac
M D Moore
Sylvester C Evet
R L. Glover
Wm Underwood
James Underwood
Jn M Geer
Thomas Smith
Wm W Moore

I am well acquainted with yore Petitioners and and the accused breech of the Peace and think they ought to be Pardoned they are Poore and has a Widow Mother to Suport and has nothing to spare to Pay a fine and if required to Pay they Will have to goe to Jail to Pay the fine
I am no relation to the Parties or attorney or instrusted in the matter I Believe from the Proof that they ought not to have been find yore friend with respects Sent to olive hill Carter County Ky
